column1: #Text=The polycrystalline samples of FexB2xMgx was prepared by solid state synthesis method, using high purity chemicals  of  (Ba(C2H3O2)2),  Fe(NO3).9H2O,  Mg(NO3)2,  citric  acid  and  Ethylene  Glycol  (Aldrich  >99.9%).
#Text=Stoichiometric  amounts  of  the  chemicals  were  weighed  using  an  electronic  balance.
#Text=The  chemicals  were  mixed  individually in 10 ml of distilled water inside different beakers.
#Text=All the chemicals were mixed in a 100 ml beaker.
#Text=The  mixture  was  stirred  at  150  oC  on  a  digital  mixer  (700  rpm)  for  thirty  minutes.
#Text=The  polyesterification  of  the  homogenous  blue  solution  was  done  at  350  oC  for  65  minutes  (>1  hour).
#Text=The  resulting  product  was  thoroughly  mixed and grinded using an agate mortar.
#Text=The product was calcine for 330 minutes (5.5 hours) in air at 850 ◦C to give a white powder.
#Text=The powder was grinded the second time using the agate mortar.
#Text=After grinding, the powder was  formed  into  cylindrical  pellets  under  a  pressure  of  13  kN  at  room  temperature  for  7  minutes.
#Text=The  pellet  was  sintered at 850 oC for 60 minutes (1 hour) and cooled in air at room temperature.
#Text=The pellet was sintered the second time  at  850  oC  for  16  hours.
#Text=The  sample  was  allowed  to  cool  in  air  at  room  temperature.
#Text=Microstructural  examinations  of  the  samples  were  done  on  a  transmission  electron  microscopy  (TEM).
#Text=The  analysis  of  the  lattice  stability  of  the  TEM  images  was  done  using  ImageJ  software.
#Text=The  CERN-Root  software  was  used  for  graphical  plots.
